The assumption is one hour per box for ground mounts and trackers, 1.5 hours per box for other types of arrays.

config.description:
[Hrs/ea]
[0.5] Stage Material + 
[1.0] Lift and Set Columns into Holes + 
[1.0] Brace Columns at Vertical

[Hrs/ea] 
[0.75] Stage Material + 
[9.0] Lift & Set Beams onto Columns + 
[3.0] Weld Beams to Columns

[Hrs/LF]
[0.0027] Shake out and stage material + 
[0.03] Install purlins on beams + 
[0.0023] Install blocking and supports
- Weld vertical plates to top of columns [1 hr welding @ ~$100/HR, prefab off-site, $50 of materials & welding consumables]
- Weld purlin braces to top of beam [0.5 welding hours per brace/purlin @ 100/hr, done on-site] plus $10/ea bracket material & welding consumables.
- Fabricate purlin hole pattern [0.02 hrs/LF of purlin at $100/HR, prefab off-site]

[# Columns] * [$40/LF for steel] * 
[Length per column (accounting for clear height, plus additional height to top of column based on tilt, plus embedment depth)]

[# Columns] * [$35/LF for steel] * 
[Length per beam (accounting for # modules high and array shape)]

[Array Length] * [# Modules high] * [2 purlins/mod] * [$/LF purlin]
$2.75/LF placeholder comes from $88/ea (27' length) price quote by MbarC reduced by ~20%.
Based on recent history, painting costs are in the ~70-80 cent/SF range for most projects (including sub OH&P), up to ~100 cents/SF on very small projects.

This is the string homerun from the array to the inverter or to the combiner box.

Grounding material for structures, $75/column

Desired finish of carport columns and beams (required, choose one).
Minimum clear height for carports above grade.
Desired type of above-grade abutments around columns, if any (optional). Typically "None" or "Bare Concrete, 30" Tall" for parking areas, "Mow Curbs" usually only used in planters.
Are there rocky soils or other difficult underground conditions?
Is there groundwater expected within the foundation depth?
Expected soil bearing capacity. "Regular" is typical, "Weak" is poor and could typically be from lots of sand, silt, coastal locations, etc.
Shape of array, in "span" direction (top to bottom). "T" is typically 6x module in portrait with the column in the middle, "L" is typically 3x in portrait with the column offset to one side.
Size of foundation (below grade), [Diameter] x [Depth]. Default is 24" x 12'.
Number of discrete arrays of this shape.
16 mins/module * module factors
Estimated $2.50/LF of rail. Can vary based on rail profile and max span (which varies with existing framing spacing, wind/snow loading, structural bearing capacity, etc).
Estimated $1 per LF of rail for Clamps, Splices, Wire Clips, End Caps, Gnd Lugs & Straps, etc.

Attachment clamp or bracket holding rails to roof (S-5! clamp for standing seam, ProteaBrakcet/CorruBracket or equivalent for corrugated metal, lag bolt and flashing for asphalt shingle, tilt hook for tile, etc), flashing included where applicable.
2 mins/mod (layout) + 2 mins/mod (acceptance/verification)
